---
title: Quick Start
description: A quick start guide to help you get started with Vue.js
---

import { Tabs, TabItem } from "@astrojs/starlight/components";

## Try Vue Onlineâ€‹

Want to experience Vue.js immediately without any setup? Try these methods:

[Our playground:](https://play.vuejs.org/#) Perfect for getting practice with the core
[JSFiddle:](https://jsfiddle.net/yyx990803/2ke1ab0z/) Helpful if your preference is an HTML setup with no builds
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-jvdgcxbv?file=index.html&terminal=dev): Great for developers who are already familiar with [Node.js](http://Node.js) and other build tools.
[Scrimba](http://scrimba.com/links/vue-quickstart): An interactive platform that allows you to write and run Vue code directly in your browser.

## Install Vue.js

If you want to install Vue locally, choose from several methods depending on your needs:

::: note
Be sure to have the latest version of [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) installed on your machine.
:::

<Tabs>
	<TabItem label="npm">```bash npm create vue@latest ```</TabItem>
	<TabItem label="pnpm">```bash pnpm create vue@latest ```</TabItem>
	<TabItem label="yarn">
	**For Yarn (v1+):**
	</TabItem>

</Tabs>
